alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 5:21AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...High Fire Danger This Afternoon and Hard Freeze Again Tonight in northeast Kentucky... A combination of dry and breezy conditions will create an elevated risk of fire spread this afternoon into early this evening. Minimum relative humidity values are forecast to drop to between 25 and 30 percent, with sustained north winds of 5 to 10 mph. Residents are urged to exercise caution if handling any potential ignition sources, such as machinery, cigarettes, or matches. If dry grasses and tree litter begin to burn, the fire will have the potential to spread rapidly. Kentucky law prohibits burning in the spring from 6AM to 6PM...February 15th through April 30th. A hard freeze is expected again tonight. Early season fruit trees, berry crops that are flowering, and other sensitive vegetation will be vulnerable to temperatures near 28 degrees fahrenheit for longer than 2 hours. Agricultural interests should take action to protect these crops.
